contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=January 2009}} '''F-type asteroids''' are a relatively uncommon type of [[carbon]]aceous [[asteroid]], falling into the wider [[C-type asteroid#C-group asteroids|C-group]]. ==Characteristics== F-type asteroids have spectra generally similar to those of the [[B-type asteroid|B-type]] asteroids, but lack the "water" absorption feature around 3 μm indicative of hydrated minerals, and differ in the low wavelength part of the [[ultraviolet]] spectrum below 0.4 μm. The '''F-type''' and [[B-type asteroid]]s are not distinguishable with the criteria used in the [[asteroid spectral types#SMASS classification|SMASS classification]], so in that scheme are grouped together under the [[B-type asteroid|B-type]]. ==See also== *[[Asteroid spectral types]] {{Asteroids}} {{Small Solar System bodies}} {{DEFAULTSORT:F-Type Asteroid}} [[Category:Asteroid spectral classes]] [[Category:F-type asteroids|*]] {{asteroid-stub}}
